Menanti Terang Kasus Novel
07 Nov 2019, 00:10 by Ali Umar
Perkembangan memprihatinkan kembali muncul dalam kasus Novel Baswedan, penyidik senior Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi yang menjadi korban penyiraman air keras. Ketika pengusutan kasusnya tak juga menghadirkan titik terang, muncul serangan opini yang menyudutkan Novel di media sosial, yang dikhawatirkan kian menjauhkan fokus terhadap penyelesaian kasus.
Novel disiram air keras oleh dua orang tak dikenal seusai salat subuh di masjid dekat rumahnya di kawasan Kelapa Gading, Jakarta Utara, pada 11 April 2017. Serangan tersebut menyebabkan kerusakan parah pada mata kirinya. Para buzzer kini mempertanyakan kesahihan cerita itu. Sejak 29 Oktober lalu, muncul tudingan di media sosial yang menganggap peristiwa itu sebagai rekayasa. Tudingan itu kian masif pada 30 Oktober dan masih terus menggema hingga 1 November 2019. Novel, yang membantah tudingan tersebut, melihat serangan di media sosial itu dilakukan secara terpola dan terorganisasi.
Munculnya serangan buzzer itu berbarengan dengan dua peristiwa penting. Pertama, uji kelayakan dan kepatutan yang dilakukan Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat terhadap Komisaris Jenderal Idham Azis-mantan Kepala Bareskrim yang pernah menjadi Ketua Tim Teknis pengusutan kasus Novel-untuk jabatan Kepala Kepolisian Negara Republik Indonesia. Yang kedua, munculnya pernyataan Presiden Joko Widodo yang memberikan tenggat kepada Idham, sebagai Kapolri baru, untuk menuntaskan pengusutan kasus Novel hingga awal Desember 2019.
Serangan buzzer ini patut diduga diatur atau ditunggangi pihak tertentu yang risau akan gencarnya sorotan dan tuntutan soal penuntasan kasus Novel. Pola kerja para pendengung kali ini mirip yang terjadi menjelang pemilihan presiden lalu, ketika mereka menyebarkan kabar-kabar bohong di media sosial untuk mempengaruhi opini publik. Polisi serta Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informatika seharusnya segera bertindak agar kabar hoaks seperti ini tidak terus beredar.
Gempuran buzzer itu menambah panjang episode kelabu perkembangan pengusutan kasus Novel. Sudah lebih dari 2,5 tahun titik terang tak juga muncul dalam pengusutan kasusnya. Tim Gabungan Pencari Fakta, yang beranggotakan 65 orang, termasuk dari luar kepolisian, tak menghasilkan temuan berarti selama bertugas sejak 8 Januari hingga 7 Juli 2019. Jangankan mengungkap dalang penyerangan, mereka bahkan gagal mengidentifikasi pelaku lapangan. Tim Teknis yang dibentuk Polri, yang dipimpin Idham Azis dan beranggotakan 120 polisi, juga gagal menghadirkan gebrakan hingga masa tugasnya berakhir pada 31 Oktober lalu.
Kini, terobosan Idham sebagai Kapolri dinantikan. Juga keberaniannya, terutama karena selama ini ada sinyalemen dari tim pengacara Novel soal dugaan keterlibatan oknum polisi dalam kasus penyerangan itu.
Bagi Jokowi, kasus Novel harus tetap menjadi prioritas. Tak tuntasnya kasus ini akan menjadi utang yang terus ditagih publik, juga akan dianggap sebagai potret buruk perlindungan hukum terhadap aktivis gerakan antikorupsi pada masa pemerintahannya. Presiden sebaiknya tak perlu ragu mewujudkan desakan publik untuk membentuk tim pencari fakta independen demi kasus ini.

Awaiting the Light of a Novel Case
Nov 7 2019, 00:10 by Ali Umar
An alarming development reappears in the case of Novel Baswedan, a senior investigator of the Corruption Eradication Commission who is a victim of hard watering. When the investigation of the case also did not bring a bright spot, there was an opinion attack that cornered Novel on social media, which was feared to increasingly distract focus on the resolution of the case.
The novel was doused with hard water by two unidentified people after dawn prayer at a mosque near his home in Kelapa Gading, North Jakarta, on April 11, 2017. The attack caused severe damage to his left eye. The buzzers are now questioning the validity of the story. Since October 29, there have been allegations on social media that consider the incident as fabricated. The accusation became more massive on October 30 and continued to echo until November 1, 2019. The novel, which denies the accusation, saw the attacks on social media as patterned and organized.
The appearance of the buzzer attack coincided with two important events. First, the fit and proper test conducted by the House of Representatives on Commissioner General Idham Azis - the former Head of Criminal Investigation who had been the Head of the Technical Team to investigate the Novel case - for the position of Chief of the National Police of the Republic of Indonesia. Secondly, the emergence of President Joko Widodo's statement which gave Idham a deadline, as the new National Police Chief, to resolve the investigation of the Novel case until early December 2019.
This buzzer attack should be suspected to be regulated or ridden by certain parties who are concerned about the intense attention and demands regarding the completion of the Novel case. The work pattern of the buzzers this time is similar to what happened before the presidential election, when they spread hoaxes on social media to influence public opinion. The police and the Ministry of Communication and Information should act immediately so that news of this hoax does not continue to circulate.
The buzzer buzz adds to the length of the gray episode in the development of the Novel case investigation. For more than 2.5 years there has not been a bright spot in the investigation of the case. The Joint Fact-Finding Team, which consists of 65 people, including from outside the police, did not produce any meaningful findings while on duty from January 8 to July 7, 2019. Instead of revealing the mastermind behind the attack, they even failed to identify the field perpetrators. The Technical Team formed by the National Police, led by Idham Azis and consisting of 120 police officers, also failed to present a breakthrough until his term ended on 31 October.
Now, Idham's breakthrough as National Police Chief is expected. Also his courage, especially since so far there has been an indication from the Novel lawyer team about the alleged involvement of a police officer in the attack.
For Jokowi, the Novel case must remain a priority. The unfinished case will become a debt that the public continues to collect, and will also be seen as a bad portrait of legal protection for anti-corruption activists during his reign. The president should not have to hesitate in realizing the public pressure to form an independent fact-finding team for this case.
Note:
This is a newspaper article in the November 7, 2019 edition
